intro: Paradrymonia tepui, commonly known as the tepui poinsettia, is a striking plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Guyana. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude, humid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a rare and ecologically significant species. Due to its restricted range, it is considered vulnerable to habitat loss and environmental changes.
